text: Explain your reason for being here

title: Mission Description
content: Only when one has fallen to the ground can they learn how to fly. If one wants to take a curtain call, they must stand on the stage once more.Explain Wonweek's true identity to Welt.

speaker: Welt
line: I know you can hide your appearance, but trespassing on restricted Family grounds is still a bold move.

speaker: Sunday
line: Don't worry. I won't take too much time.

speaker: Sunday
line: I was a child when I first visited the Grand Theater . I remember seeing the light behind the curtains from here and believing it to be the Morning Star guiding me toward the Land of the Dreams.

speaker: Sunday
line: When I returned here many years later as the head of the Oak Family , I finally learned that the light was actually a Stellaron .

speaker: Welt
line: Now that you've returned to the stage, what are you planning to do?

speaker: Sunday
line: Prepare for my departure. I've always believed that a person's starting point should also be his last stop.

speaker: Sunday
line: Have you ever seen the elderly at the end of their lives? As they welcome their final moments, they invariably raise their hands, stretching their arms into the emptiness. Much like how babies also stretch their arms into the air when they are first born.

speaker: Sunday
line: Humanity flaps their wings twice as they complete their journey: Once when they are born, and once when they die. In order to flap my own wings and soar again...

speaker: Sunday
line: I will say goodbye here to the me of yesterday.

speaker: Wonweek
line: I really hate this face. My expressions feel so dull and lifeless.

speaker: Welt
line: I see. That explains why something always felt off about your appearance.

speaker: Welt
line: The halo above your head that symbolizes the Harmony — it's been missing since the moment we reunited.

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Bow Out At Moment of Début.mp4

speaker: Sunday
line: It's true that this ring was bestowed upon our people by the heavens, but that doesn't mean it can't be thrown away.

speaker: Sunday
line: While I was in the Gallery of Thoughts, at the entrance of the dream, I chose to completely sever the halo from myself.

speaker: Welt
line: Why?

speaker: Sunday
line: I am a fugitive, after all. I must remove any chance of being detected by The Family.

speaker: Sunday
line: Another reason is to feel pain... A pain like falling from the sky with broken wings that can keep me awake.

speaker: Sunday
line: This is how I can cast aside all the blessings of the Harmony and the Order and, for the first time in my life, enter the sweet dream as an ordinary person.

speaker: Welt
line: Is that also how Mr. Wonweek came into this world?

speaker: Wonweek
line: Hmph, no, you wouldn't believe the real story even if he told you.

speaker: Sunday
line: He was born from an accident, one that you're actually quite familiar with...

speaker: Sunday
line: It was that Try-not-to-Laugh challenge. Quite embarrassing, to be honest.

speaker: Sunday
line: I was roaming around as an ordinary person when I unfortunately fell into that Pepeshi 's trap. The prank that fragmented Miss Tingyun also divided my fragile self into two.

speaker: Welt
line: Are you saying that he's a part of you? That's quite surprising, given that you two looked nothing alike.

speaker: Sunday
line: You could say he's another possibility of me.

speaker: Sunday
line: I, too, was once a child, with aspirations buried deep within. Over time, those childhood voices grew increasingly faint.

speaker: Sunday
line: Maybe if I had made a small change in my childhood, I would have turned out to be exactly like him.

speaker: Wonweek
line: What a pity, failing to become a better version of yourself.

speaker: Sunday
line: So, my final farewell will be like that of Miss Tingyun: I will perform a tuning on myself and return to my complete form.

speaker: Sunday
line: And this also means that Wonweek will vanish for good. That's why I said this was the last stop.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Is there a possibility that you will be the one who disappears?

speaker: Sunday
line: No, this is a foregone conclusion.

speaker: Sunday
line: But who's to say there won't be any changes? Maybe deep down, I'm also anticipating this possibility.

speaker: Welt
line: Regardless of the outcome, you will have a witness.

speaker: Welt
line: I'll be waiting for you in the audience.

speaker: Sunday
line: Much appreciated.

speaker: Sunday
line: Now, shall we begin?

speaker: Wonweek
line: "Anticipating this possibility..." You've really changed. In the past, you wouldn't have tolerated any noise at all.

speaker: Sunday
line: I'm about to embark on an unknown journey, where it will be impossible to maintain my orderly life. I will have to navigate unexpected surprises, much like today.

speaker: Wonweek
line: You're not ready at all, are you?

speaker: Sunday
line: I feel unsettled, maybe even scared. Ever since I left Penacony , I could no longer control everything.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Don't flatter yourself. You can't control anything.

speaker: Wonweek
line: But isn't that how it is for most people?

speaker: Sunday
line: My fear of the unknown may be a weakness, but your presence has shown me that surprises aren't always bad.

speaker: Sunday
line: Meeting you has been a great help to me, and I'm glad to have discovered this side of myself. I also feel grateful for the opportunity to tell you this in person...

speaker: Sunday
line: I truly dislike you.

speaker: Wonweek
line: What? Are you sure you didn't mean the opposite?

speaker: Sunday
line: I must admit, many of your qualities strike a chord with me. There are times when I want to joke around, freely express my thoughts, or openly share my dislike of a person...

speaker: Sunday
line: Or my fondness. I want to tell her that I love all her songs.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Then go for it, Sunny. You always talk about locking the bird in the cage, but you're the one who's trapped.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Look at yourself. Besides discipline and hesitation, there's nothing else in your life. If you continue living like a slab of marble, you'll break into pieces when you fall.

speaker: Sunday
line: But I won't become like you. I simply can't.

speaker: Sunday
line: I dislike people who are frivolous. It makes me uncomfortable to even emulate them. If I fail, I will still uphold my principles, such as decorum and stateliness.

speaker: Sunday
line: As for the Harmony, my stance remains the same. Whether it's you or the Paths, if what I once doubted — or even opposed — becomes the force I must rely on in the future...

speaker: Sunday
line: Then this time, my true heart will guide the tuning.

speaker: Sunday
line: I'll leave it to you.

speaker: Wonweek
line: What is this? Leaving your fate entirely up to a coin flip?

speaker: Wonweek
line: This isn't like you at all. Did you lose your mind after being run over by the Express , or were you possessed by that IPC gambler ?

speaker: Sunday
line: Failure is always the best teacher. To save more lives, you must first understand what they live for and what they die for. The best way to achieve this is through personal experience.

speaker: Sunday
line: You see? I'm already starting to make changes.

speaker: Sunday
line: Whether it's us merging or one of us disappearing, I'll leave the tuning to fate, and see if I can embrace all that I detest.

speaker: Sunday
line: Only then will I truly be able to walk among the living in their world.

speaker: Wonweek
line: But what if you can't do it?

speaker: Sunday
line: Well, that's out of my hands. It will just prove that I'm still the same person...

speaker: Sunday
line: The person who always disappoints his sister ...

speaker: Sunday
line: Falling is just another name for flying.

speaker: Sunday
line: That's why I rejoice at my broken wings.

speaker: Sunday
line: Step into the mortal world to see how it truly is.

speaker: Sunday
line: Then, be born as a human and die as one.

speaker: Sunday
line: And with my last breath, I'll join the weak... in reaching my hands toward the sky.

speaker: Sunday
line: On the Planet of Festivities, whatever identities I once had, they no longer matter.

speaker: Sunday
line: It's not the Gods who answer us, but ourselves from the future.

speaker: Wonweek
line: I don't have much to say. But as it's time to part ways, here's one last piece of advice.

speaker: Wonweek
line: When telling jokes, be sincere. Don't sweat the details, and above all, don't explain them every time.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Ah, never mind. Maybe it's better for you not to joke at all.

speaker: Sunday
line: No objections from me.

speaker: Wonweek
line: This is so annoying. How did I become so dull?

speaker: Wonweek
line: Well, despite everything, try not to be too hard on yourself. There will always be people who are sad.

speaker: Sunday
line: Mm.

title: Step Description
content: Only when one has fallen to the ground can they learn how to fly. If one wants to take a curtain call, they must stand on the stage once more.Complete your own tuning.

children.speaker: Wonweek
children.line: Planet of Festivities, Land of the Dreams, I say goodbye to my home.

children.speaker: Wonweek
children.line: Should one desire to leave the stage for good...

children.speaker: "Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus
children.line: One must first step back onto the stage.

text: (Begin battle against"Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus×1(Phases 1 and 2)

speaker: Sunday
line: As expected, the trickiest thing is tuning yourself.

speaker: Sunday
line: These dissonant sounds are much too harsh.

text: (After "Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus uses Accelerando for the first time)

speaker: Sunday
line: Echoes of the past, you need not fade away.

speaker: Sunday
line: Follow me, to the stars.

text: (After "Harmonious Choir" The Great Septimus enters Phase 2)

speaker: Sunday
line: The time has come. Let it be revealed...

speaker: Sunday
line: Is it "inevitable" for me?

text:
(After winning the battle)
(UnlockAchievementA New Venture on the Eighth Dawn)

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: On this eighth day, I grant myself—

title: Step Description
content: Having resolved to advance, Sunday decides to look back on his past... Having embraced everything that happened, on the eighth day, the day of his departure also embraces him. However, he is still missing one thing... Permission to board the Express.

speaker: Welt
line: Well, how should I address you now? Mr. Sunday or Mr. Wonweek?

speaker: Sunday
line: Whichever you prefer. He's probably mocking me from inside right now.

speaker: Sunday
line: Thank you for accompanying me through all this, Mr. Yang. This farewell journey has come to an end.

speaker: Welt
line: What are your plans after leaving Penacony?

speaker: Sunday
line: At this point, there is no need to hide things from you. I believe there's more to the incident involving the Stellaron on Penacony.

speaker: Welt
line: Are you suggesting that the Dreammaster wasn't the one controlling the Stellaron?

speaker: Sunday
line: Don't worry. The Oak Family was indeed behind seizing the Stellaron and resurrecting the fallen Aeon during the Charmony Festival , and you've already defeated them.

speaker: Sunday
line: But Mr. Gopher Wood once told me that all the Order's efforts were aimed at avoiding the same mistakes that the Harmony made.

speaker: Sunday
line: My guess is that the Family from the Montour System must be involved.

speaker: Sunday
line: Unfortunately, too much time has passed to verify that. Penacony is just a small territory, and even the family heads with their authority cannot enter the sacred site of the Harmony and inquire about the true will of the Great One.

speaker: Sunday
line: In the worst-case scenario, if Xipe turned a blind eye, how could "the strong defending the weak" hold up?

speaker: Sunday
line: Mr. Yang, I just want to tell you this: The Harmony has more than one side. THEY can be the most steadfast ally of the Astral Express or the most fearsome enemy.

speaker: Welt
line: Thank you for being honest with me. The efforts of the Crew on Penacony were driven by the same concern.

speaker: Welt
line: After all this, the Harmony and the Preservation will keep the situation on the Planet of Festivities in balance. With the momentum from the Trailblaze , more forces will arrive, and Penacony will become a public space in the Cosmos.

speaker: Welt
line: Freedom is the only answer the Nameless can offer. I'm glad that Penacony needs it.

speaker: Sunday
line: You and I both strive for a peaceful society, even if our reasons are different, and you've gone even further than I have.

speaker: Sunday
line: If not for our Paths, perhaps you and I wouldn't be in opposition.

speaker: Welt
line: Don't sell yourself short. We're not fundamentally opposed. Otherwise, you wouldn't have shown me mercy in front of the Dreammaster.

speaker: Welt
line: This shared journey is my way of repaying you. After all—

speaker: Welt
line: You are one of my Trailblazing goals.

speaker: Sunday
line: About that, you've given me many insights as well. Humans are the measure of everything, and no one is the sole savior.

speaker: Sunday
line: Creating a paradise remains one of my lifelong ambitions. As I move forward, I realize I must build it brick by brick. Therefore, I have a request that I hope you'll consider...

speaker: Sunday
line: While I lack the will to Trailblaze, nor can I become a true Nameless...

speaker: Sunday
line: I admire your convictions. Perhaps, what I need, more than asceticism, is knowledge.

speaker: Sunday
line: Therefore, after leaving Penacony, would you consider letting me...

speaker: Sunday
line: Come aboard the Astral Express and travel with you for now?

text: When you have a chance to make a choice, make one that you know you won't regret.
